oai_dc:dc.dc:title: They will go caroling for Fannie Battle Day Home Christmas Eve, circa 1951 December 12
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph of a group of junior choir members at Shelby Avenue Baptist Church, circa 12 December 1951, seen practicing for singing carols on Christmas Eve for benefit of the Fannie Battle Day Home. Their designated area was the East Nashville area with Mrs. J.T. Dugger. They are front row, left to right, Miss Barbara Oliver, Miss Barbara West, Miss Connie Ray, Miss Jewell Marie Spencer and Miss Shirley Ann Willis; back row, Miss Dixie West, Miss Ann Ray, Miss Loretta Stewart, Miss Barbara Herod and Miss Christine Pomeroy. This photograph illustrated the newspaper article "They will go caroling for Fannie Battle Day Home Christmas Eve," published in the 12 December 1951 issue of the Nashville Banner. Forms part of the Fannie Battle Day Home Records. 1 photograph : b & w ; 10 x 8.25 in.
